paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variant T60A, including penetrance data and individual case details.

patients.demographics: Heterozygous carriers, specific demographics not detailed
patients.phenotype: Mixed phenotype of neuropathy and cardiomyopathy

individual_records.evidence_sentence: We extracted ATTR fibrils from the heart of three individuals that carried the ttr mutation T60A in heterozygosis.
We extracted ATTR fibrils from the heart of three individuals that carried the ttr mutation T60A in heterozygosis.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Cardiac symptoms and amyloid deposition in other organs
individual_records.evidence_sentence: We extracted ATTR fibrils from the heart of three individuals that carried the ttr mutation T60A in heterozygosis.

functional_data.summary: ATTRv-T60A fibrils exhibit a consistent 'closed-gate' conformation across different organs.

variants.segregation_data: The T60A variant segregates with disease in the studied patients.
variants.population_frequency: 1% in the population of County Donegal, Ireland.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on structural and clinical data.
variants.additional_notes: The T60A mutation is associated with a dominant cardiac phenotype.
key_quotes: ATTRv-T60A amyloidosis presents as a mixed phenotype of neuropathy and cardiomyopathy, with a dominant cardiac phenotype that is a major determinant of its poor prognosis.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding the TTR variant T60A was extracted successfully.
